quotes.quote: All coaching is, is taking a player where he can't take himself.
To be successful in coaching you have to treat your team like a family. The leader needs backing from everyone.
Selecting the right person for the right job is the largest part of coaching.
Coaching is nothing more than eliminating mistakes before you get fired.
I learned this about coaching: You don't have to explain victory and you can't explain defeat.
Coaching helps you take stock of where you are now in all aspects of your life, and how that compares to where you would like to be.
The better the coaching has become, the worse the game has become.
Coaching really is an individual philosophy.
Coaching is a profession of love. You can't coach people unless you love them.
The purpose of training is to tighten up the slack, toughen the body, and polish the spirit.
It's all to do with the training: you can do a lot if you're properly trained.
The best training program in the world is absolutely worthless without the will to execute it properly, consistently, and with intensity.
Training gives us an outlet for suppressed energies created by stress and thus tones the spirit just as exercise conditions the body.
An individual step in character training is to put responsibility on the individual.
The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.
Training is all-encompassing and should be related to everything a unit does, or can have happen to it.

Training is such a vital part of preparation for a game, you really do train to play. It tops up your ability, like sharpening a carving knife. You can get away with not doing it for a while, as long as you have reached a certain standard of fitness.
Coaching is an action, not a title and actions result in successes!
Coaching doesn't start with X's and O's. It starts with believing that players win games and coaches win players.
Coaching is unlocking a person's potential to maximize their own performance. It is helping them to learn rather than teaching them.
Good coaching may be defined as the development of character, personality and habits of players, plus the teaching of fundamentals and team play.
Does coaching work? Yes. Good coaches provide a truly important service. They tell you the truth when no one else will.
By not providing coaching to people after providing them with behaviorally-based skill training, we set them up for failure.
Coaching is the most important servant leadership element in helping people accomplish their goals.
Coaching is effective self-expression in the coach/client relationship so that you catalyze your clients' manifestation of their own desired outcomes.
Coaching isn't an addition to a leader's job, it's an integral part of it.
Coaching is helping people grow without telling them what to do.
Coaching is not a natural way of life. Your victories and losses are too clear cut.
Coaching is people management- getting people to do what you want them to do and like doing it
Coaching does not permit democracy.
[Coaching is] helping people discover what they could not discover on their own, so they can become what they want to become.
Coaching isn't a great mystery. It's Just hard work, determination, and inspiration at the right moment.
By instructing students how to learn, unlearn and relearn, a powerful new dimension can be added to education.
The interesting thing about coaching is that you have to trouble the comfortable, and comfort the troubled
Coaching doesn't make sick people well...it helps healthy people become extra-ordinary.
Coaching is the art and practice of guiding a person or group from where they are toward the greater competence and fulfillment that they desire.
Coaching is not how much you know. It's how much you can get players to do.
Coaching is unlocking a person's potential to maximize their own performance. It is helping them to learn rather than teaching them.
The key to coaching is not what you do, but the way you do it. The intangibles, the motivational parts of the game are the most important facets of it
It doesn't matter where you coach, it matters why you coach.
Good coaching is about leadership and instilling respect in your players. Dictators lead through fear--good coaches do not.
My coaching philosophy? Determine your players talents and give them every weapon to get the most from those talents.
The goal of coaching is not in fixing what is broken, but in discovering new talents and new ways to use old talents that lead to far greater effectiveness.
The single most important thing in coaching is turning out educated kids who are ready for society.
We know the principles of coaching. The art is knowing when to apply them.
Coaching is like being a king. It prepares you for nothing.
I define coaching as launching the salesperson on a voyage of discovery by asking questions.
It's all about training smart.
The only side effect of too much training is that you get into better shape. There is nothing wrong with that.
Good coaching is good teaching and nothing else.
